Psychology_4_p$Psychology_tweet_13_p$Psy.text:
Finding A: Third, in all three cities, new cases of autism were identified by the study in mainstream schools, reflecting current under-diagnosis.
Finding B: Our results support the notion that the adolescent brain remains receptive to training, underscoring the importance of enrichment during teenage years.
Finding C: More strikingly, risk was 80-83% increased in the first 0-4 years of life, an increase that was restricted to infantile autism.
Finding D: Although labels appear to also influence intensity ratings and reaction times, this seems to be a more complex relationship that could be modulated by additional factors such as odor valence, label fit, and possibly the edibility attributed to an odor or a label.

Finding D: Although labels appear to also influence intensity ratings and reaction times, this seems to be a more complex relationship that could be modulated by additional factors such as odor valence, label fit, and possibly the edibility attributed to an odor or a label.

Psychology_tweet_179_r$Psychology_191_p$.text:
Finding A: Year of the Woman? @username A 2016 study from the Journal of Consumer Research showed women are better at compromising, stating compromise is “nearly guaranteed when a woman is involved in decision-making pairs.”
Finding B: The findings indicate that students provided with stand-biased desks did not decrease in their academic engagement in the classroom when compared with their seated counterparts.
Finding C: "These findings provide a neural basis for understanding how depression relates to poor sleep quality, and this in turn has implications for treatment of depression and improvement of sleep quality because of the brain areas identified."
Finding D: Third, with the existence of these strengths-based interventions, social services providers can develop a program of services that support black gay and bisexual men's HIV-negativity maintenance.

Psychology_35_r$Psychology_23_r$Psycholo.text:
Finding A: "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.
Finding B: The study identified a significant association between corporal punishment during childhood and violence toward dating partners in adulthood.
Finding C: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor\'s gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].
Finding D: Simple and familiar icons were the easiest to find, but when the task got harder, aesthetically appealing icons provided a performance boost that was not found for less-appealing visuals.
Psychology_35_r$Psychology_23_r$Psycholo.displayed_text:
Finding A: "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.
Finding B: The study identified a significant association between corporal punishment during childhood and violence toward dating partners in adulthood.
Finding C: Furthermore, dogs followed the actor\'s gaze significantly less in the BC compared to the O condition [cumulative accuracy, two-sample t test, t(24) = 22.107, p = 0.045].
Finding D: Simple and familiar icons were the easiest to find, but when the task got harder, aesthetically appealing icons provided a performance boost that was not found for less-appealing visuals.

Psychology_tweet_161_r$Psychology_tweet_.displayed_text:
Finding A: Power of touch ✋️in relieving pain
Finding B: In contrast, there was on average no change in perceived pleasure from smoking cigarettes when using marijuana (5.3 ± 2.7, t (199) ¼ 1.7, p ¼ .09).
Finding C: When we separated recent vs. established ophthalmic conditions, we found a 46% higher AD risk in participants with recent glaucoma compared with those without, but no increased risk for those with established glaucoma.
Finding D: The analysis showed that these functional connectivities underlie the relation between depressive problems and sleep quality.

Psychology_494_p$Psychology_425_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Signs and symptoms of an eating disorder should always be taken seriously and not dismissed or minimized.
Finding B: Third, in future research, it will be crucial to further explore the functional relevance of our findings and to examine how normative sexrelated phenotypic diversity in brain structure relates to sex differences in general cognitive or behavioral profiles (eg, as shown by Miller and Halpern 40 and by Hyde 41 ) and to different clinical ASD phenotypes.
Finding C: When researchers from Stanford University of Medicine were examining sleeping patterns in adults over a 10 year-period, 20 participants out of the group of 420 unfortunately committed suicide.
Finding D: From JAMA Ophthalmology: How does amblyopia influence self-perception in children ages 8 to 13 years? These results suggest lower self-perception and its association with reading speed and motor skills...

Psychology_tweet_15_p$Psychology_427_r$P.text:
Finding A: One of the key messages from this study is that among men at high-risk for HIV who remain HIV negative (i.e., \'\'positive deviants\'\'), there may be successive decisionmaking across a timeline to a sexual event that reduces risk, even if a condom is not used.
Finding B: The group that had been asleep were better at remembering the German translations of the Dutch words they had heard in their sleep.
Finding C: Coping planning showed an interaction with received social support for continuous abstinence (p< .05, see Table 2 , third column).
Finding D: Unexpected brain plasticity revealed for the human visual system after cataract removal.
